intro: Gnidia gossweileri subsp. gossweileri, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. Gnidia gossweileri subsp. gossweileri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
